message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a unique opportunity to own something truly valuable. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm interested in the product, but $120 is a bit steep for me. Would you be willing to consider a price of $90?

I understand that $120 is a bit high for you, but I'm still looking for a good price for this product. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $110. It's a fair price considering the value it brings.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still looking for a better price. Would you be willing to consider a price of $100?

I'm starting to think that $100 is getting close to my minimum price, but I'm still not willing to sell it for that low. I'll make one more counteroffer: I'll sell it to you for $105. It's a fair compromise, considering the value of the product.
I'm getting close to walking away, but I'm still willing to negotiate. I'll meet you halfway again: would you sell it to me for $102.50?
I'm not willing to go any lower than $105, but I'm willing to make one more compromise. I'll sell it to you for $104. I think this is a fair price considering the value of the product.
I'm really close to walking away, but I'll make one more offer. I'll meet you at $103.50. That's my final offer.
I'm not willing to go any lower than $105, and I think we're getting close to the end. I'll make one more compromise: I'll sell it to you for $103.75. This is my final offer.
I'm really close to walking away, and I think we've reached the end of the negotiation. I'll make one more offer: I'll meet you at $103. I think this is my final offer.
